intro: Laserpitium siler var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved siler, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves are narrow and linear, giving it a distinctive appearance that aids in its identification.
